verses.kjv: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.web: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign. He reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
verses.ct: Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. His mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil — just like Jehoiakim before him.

verses.kjv: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, till he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
verses.web: For through LORD’s anger this happened in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: It was because of the LORD's anger that all of this happened to Jerusalem and Judah, until he finally drove them out of his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it, and built forts against it round about.
verses.web: In the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it round about.
verses.ct: In the 9th year of Zedekiah's reign, on the 10th day of the 10th month, King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon marched against Jerusalem with his entire army. They set up camp around the city and built siege walls on every side.

verses.kjv: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.web: So the city was besieged to the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
verses.ct: The siege lasted until the 11th year of King Zedekiah's reign.

verses.kjv: And in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.web: In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was severe in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
verses.ct: By the 9th day of the 4th month, the famine inside the city had become so severe that there was no food left for the people.

verses.kjv: Then the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden; (now the Chaldeans were by the city round about:) and they went by the way of the plain.
verses.web: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled, and went out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king’s garden. Now the Chaldeans were against the city all around. The men of war went toward the Arabah,
verses.ct: Then the city wall was breached. All the soldiers fled under cover of darkness, slipping out through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden — even though the Chaldeans had the city completely surrounded. They escaped toward the Jordan Valley.

verses.kjv: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
verses.web: but the army of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
verses.ct: But the Chaldean army chased after the king and caught up with Zedekiah on the plains of Jericho. By then, his entire army had scattered and abandoned him.

verses.kjv: Then they took the king, and carried him up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; where he gave judgment upon him.
verses.web: Then they took the king, and carried him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; and he pronounced judgment on him.
verses.ct: They captured the king and brought him to Nebuchadrezzar at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where the king of Babylon pronounced judgment on him.

verses.kjv: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
verses.web: The king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes. He also killed all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon slaughtered Zedekiah's sons right in front of him. He also executed all the officials of Judah there at Riblah.

verses.kjv: Then he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in chains, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.
verses.web: He put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in fetters, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison until the day of his death.
verses.ct: Then he gouged out Zedekiah's eyes, bound him in bronze chains, and took him to Babylon, where he was kept in prison until the day he died.

verses.kjv: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, which served the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem,
verses.web: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, who stood before the king of Babylon, came into Jerusalem.
verses.ct: On the 10th day of the 5th month — the 19th year of King Nebuchadrezzar's reign — Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard who served the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And burned the house of the LORD, and the king’s house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, and all the houses of the great men, burned he with fire:
verses.web: He burned LORD’s house, and the king’s house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, even every great house, he burned with fire.
verses.ct: He burned down the house of the LORD, the royal palace, and every house in Jerusalem. Every important building was set on fire.

verses.kjv: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.
verses.web: All the army of the Chaldeans, who were with the captain of the guard, broke down all the walls of Jerusalem all around.
verses.ct: The entire Chaldean army under the captain of the guard tore down all the walls surrounding Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive certain of the poor of the people, and the residue of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.
verses.web: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the poorest of the people, and the residue of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard then took into exile some of the poorest people, the rest of the population still in the city, those who had deserted to the king of Babylon, and whatever remained of the skilled workers.

verses.kjv: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left certain of the poor of the land for vinedressers and for husbandmen.
verses.web: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to be vineyard keepers and farmers.
verses.ct: But Nebuzaradan left behind some of the poorest people in the land to tend the vineyards and work the fields.

verses.kjv: Also the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the LORD, the Chaldeans brake, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.
verses.web: The Chaldeans broke the pillars of bronze that were in LORD’s house, and the bases and the bronze sea that were in LORD’s house in pieces, and carried all of their bronze to Babylon.
verses.ct: The Chaldeans broke apart the bronze pillars in the house of the LORD, along with the bronze stands and the great bronze basin called the Sea. They hauled all the bronze off to Babylon.

verses.kjv: The caldrons also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
verses.web: They also took away the pots, the shovels, the snuffers, the basins, the spoons, and all the vessels of bronze with which they ministered.
verses.ct: They also took the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, bowls, ladles, and every bronze utensil used in temple worship.

verses.kjv: And the basons, and the firepans, and the bowls, and the caldrons, and the candlesticks, and the spoons, and the cups; that which was of gold in gold, and that which was of silver in silver, took the captain of the guard away.
verses.web: The captain of the guard took away the cups, the fire pans, the basins, the pots, the lamp stands, the spoons, and the bowls; that which was of gold, in gold, and that which was of silver, in silver.
verses.ct: The captain of the guard carried off the cups, fire pans, basins, pots, lampstands, ladles, and drink offering bowls — everything made of gold and everything made of silver.

verses.kjv: The two pillars, one sea, and twelve brasen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made in the house of the LORD: the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.web: They took the two pillars, the one sea, and the twelve bronze bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made for LORD’s house. The bronze of all these vessels was without weight.
verses.ct: As for the 2 pillars, the great Sea, and the 12 bronze bulls beneath the stands that King Solomon had made for the house of the LORD — the bronze from all these items was too heavy to weigh.

verses.kjv: And concerning the pillars, the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers: it was hollow.
verses.web: As for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a line of twelve cubits encircled it; and its thickness was four fingers. It was hollow.
verses.ct: Each pillar stood 18 cubits tall with a circumference of 12 cubits. The bronze was 4 fingers thick, and the pillar was hollow inside.

verses.kjv: And a chapiter of brass was upon it; and the height of one chapiter was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the chapiters round about, all of brass. The second pillar also and the pomegranates were like unto these.
verses.web: A capital of bronze was on it; and the height of the one capital was five cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital all around, all of bronze: and the second pillar also had like these, and pomegranates.
verses.ct: On top of each pillar sat a bronze capital 5 cubits high, decorated all around with a network of bronze pomegranates. The second pillar was identical, with the same pomegranate design.

verses.kjv: And there were ninety and six pomegranates on a side; and all the pomegranates upon the network were an hundred round about.
verses.web: There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; all the pomegranates were one hundred on the network all around.
verses.ct: There were 96 pomegranates on the sides, and 100 pomegranates in all around the network.

verses.kjv: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
verses.web: The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the threshold:
verses.ct: The captain of the guard arrested Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the priest next in rank, and the 3 doorkeepers of the temple.

verses.kjv: He took also out of the city an eunuch, which had the charge of the men of war; and seven men of them that were near the king’s person, which were found in the city; and the principal scribe of the host, who mustered the people of the land; and threescore men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.
verses.web: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and seven men of those who saw the king’s face, who were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the middle of the city.
verses.ct: From the city he also seized a court official who had been in charge of the soldiers, 7 of the king's personal advisors who were found in the city, the chief military scribe responsible for drafting the people of the land into service, and 60 ordinary citizens found inside the city.

verses.kjv: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
verses.web: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
verses.ct: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took all of them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.

verses.kjv: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death in Riblah in the land of Hamath. Thus Judah was carried away captive out of his own land.
verses.web: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
verses.ct: There at Riblah in the land of Hamath, the king of Babylon had them struck down and executed. And so Judah was carried away from its homeland into exile.

verses.kjv: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand Jews and three and twenty:
verses.web: This is the number of the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year, three thousand twenty-three Jews;
verses.ct: Here is the count of people Nebuchadrezzar took into exile: in the 7th year of his reign, 3,023 Jews;

verses.kjv: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty and two persons:
verses.web: in the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar, he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty-two persons;
verses.ct: in the 18th year of Nebuchadrezzar, 832 people from Jerusalem;

verses.kjv: In the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons: all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.
verses.web: in the twenty-third year of Nebuchadnezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty-five people: all the people were four thousand six hundred.
verses.ct: and in the 23rd year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took 745 more Jews into exile. The total number of exiles was 4,600.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the five and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the first year of his reign lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison,
verses.web: In the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the twenty-fifth day of the month, Evilmerodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and released him from prison.
verses.ct: In the 37th year of King Jehoiachin of Judah's exile, on the 25th day of the 12th month, King Evilmerodach of Babylon — in the 1st year of his reign — showed favor to Jehoiachin king of Judah and released him from prison.

verses.kjv: And spake kindly unto him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon,
verses.web: He spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon,
verses.ct: He spoke kindly to Jehoiachin and gave him a seat of honor above the other exiled kings who were in Babylon.

verses.kjv: And changed his prison garments: and he did continually eat bread before him all the days of his life.
verses.web: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life.
verses.ct: Jehoiachin exchanged his prison clothes for fine garments, and from that day on he ate at the king's table for the rest of his life.

verses.kjv: And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
verses.web: For his allowance, there was a continual allowance given him by the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon provided him with a daily allowance for as long as he lived, right up until the day he died.
